page.title: 02ST MAWGAN CHURCH
page.content: We interviewed Father Michael Peters, who has been at St Mawgan 3 years. St Mawgan might have had a church in the 5th century of wood and thatch.In the 12th century a cross shaped church was built.The church has its own seasons, reflected in the altar cloth. Advent and Lent_ purple (fasting period), Christmas, Easter and Ascension- white and gold, Saints Feasts days-red, Epiphany and Trinity- green(for growth Different costumes are worn for confirmations, communions and weddings 3 organisations are attached to the church, the M.E.E. Club 13s and over, Sunday School and Time Together for adults. Every Sunday there is a communion with a congregation of between 70-100.On the first Sunday each month there is a Family Eucharist with a congregation of about 90.Early morning services are held on Mon & Fri
